messages.title: BURNING MONEY
messages.content: As fuel costs rise, local people ask: 'How can I afford to heat my home?'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour's decision to abolish the 10p tax rate hit the most vulnerable the hardest. Many felt it was the final betrayal of Labour's heartland.
Jo Swinson has energetically campaigned against energy companies that have made billions but still let the poorest customers pay over the odds for their bills.
Nick Clegg's Lib Dems are taking action to stop thousands of homeowners losing their homes. The three point plan to stop banks rushing to repossess homes.

mentions.candidate: Jo Swinson campaigning for real action to help pensioners hit by rising living costs
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Cameron will cut taxes for millionaires, but what about the rest of us?
mentions.partyLeader: Nick Clegg: 'It's time to give our troops a better deal!'

issues.governance: The government should act and make energy companies cut bills for their most vulnerable customers.
issues.socialWelfare: Many more people than last year say they are economising on food or are worried about how they are going to make ends meet.

housing.content: Nick Clegg's Lib Dems are taking action to stop thousands of homeowners losing their homes.

politicalExperience.achievements: Campaigning for real action to help pensioners hit by rising living costs

contactInformation.address: Liberal Democrats, Penmorvah House, 2 The Drive, Hove, BN3 3JA

quotes.text: Labour's decision to abolish the 10p tax rate hit the most vulnerable the hardest. Many felt it was the final betrayal of Labour's heartland.
Energy companies have announced massive price hikes in recent months despite record profits.

images.caption: Lib Dem MP Jo Swinson campaigning for real action to help pensioners hit by rising living costs.
